while statement

　The while statement repeatedly executes a statement or block while a specified condition is true. You can create loops.
　The syntax is as follows:

while(expression)
    Statement or block

　The "statement or block" is executed repeatedly as long as the conditional expression is true.

　In operation,
(1) First, evaluate expression; if false, the statement or block is not executed
(2) Execute a statement or block
(3) Evaluate expression, and if the result is true, go to (2); otherwise, end the while statement

　That is, if expression is false from the beginning, the statement or block is not executed. Also, expression is not always evaluated, and expression is checked for truth each time a statement or block is executed.
　In addition, at the time of (3), if the block is a block, the block is exited (variables are deleted).

例:
    while(func()) ;
    /* Continue to evaluate func() without doing anything while func() is true */

    while(func()) i++;
    /* Keep executing i++ while func() is true */

    while(i < 5) // while i is less than 5
    {
        func(i);
        i++;
    }

break

　Write a break statement when you want to terminate while in the middle.

例:
    while(true) // Infinite loop unless break is executed
    {
        if(func()) break; // If func() is true, end while
        func2(); // Come here if break is not executed above
    }
    // Come here when break is executed

continue

　Describe the continue statement when you want to start over from evaluating the conditional expression.
　When continue is executed, execution moves to (3).

例:
    var i = 0;
    while(i < 5)
    {
        if(func1()) continue;
        // If func1() is true, the condition check of i < 5 is performed.
        // Also executed from the beginning of the block
        func2();
        i++;
    }

do-while

　The do-while statement is the same as the while statement, but does not check the conditional expression first.
　The syntax is as follows:

do
    Statement or block
while(expression);

　Since the conditional expression is not checked first, the "statement or block" is executed even if the conditional expression is false at the time of do.
　Once the "statement or block" is executed, the conditional expression is checked. If false, the loop is exited; if true, the statement or block is executed again, and so on.
